name: audio-trimmer
title: Audio Trimmer
description: Trim audio files by specifying start and end timestamps
content:
Overview

This application trims audio files by cutting them to specified start and end timestamps. Built using pydub, it provides precise audio trimming with support for multiple timestamp formats.

Features

  • Trim audio by start and end timestamps
  • Flexible timestamp formats (HH:MM:SS, MM:SS, or SS)
  • Preserves original audio quality and format
  • Automatic validation of timestamp ranges

Parameters

  • Input Audio: Upload your audio file from stash
  • Start Time: Starting timestamp (default: 0)
  • End Time: Ending timestamp (leave empty for end of file)
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Timestamp Format

Use one of these formats:

  • SS: Seconds (e.g., "30" = 30 seconds)
  • MM:SS: Minutes:Seconds (e.g., "1:30" = 1 minute 30 seconds)
  • HH:MM:SS: Hours:Minutes:Seconds (e.g., "0:1:30" = 1 minute 30 seconds)

Output

The application generates a trimmed audio file with "_trimmed" appended to the original filename in the specified output directory.

Use Cases

  • Extracting specific sections from podcasts or interviews
  • Removing silence or unwanted content from recordings
  • Creating audio clips from longer files
  • Preparing audio segments for presentations
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && apt-get update && apt-get install -y ffmpeg && python "prod_apps/python/audio_trimmer.py" "${inputFile}" -s "${startTime}" -e "${endTime}" -o "${outputDir}"
